TEXT.TEXTVALUE: Arrange the reagents and materials required for the experiment on the lab table. Click on each apparatus and reagents to know its name or click on the “Continue” button to start the experiment.
A 15-20g of orange peel is taken from the plate.
The orange peels are then added to a blender.
The lid of the standard flask containing 0.1M phosphate buffer is opened and 40ml of the buffer is transferred to a measuring cylinder.
The measured buffer is then transferred to the blender containing orange peels.
The measuring cylinder is kept back on the lab bench.
The blender is closed with the lid.
The blender is switched ON.
The contents in the blender are allowed to mix.
A 40 ml of 0.1M phosphate buffer is transferred again to the measuring cylinder .
The buffer is then added to the blender containing orange peels.The blender is closed with the lid.
The measuring cylinder is kept back on the lab bench.
The blender is switched ON.
The contents in the blender are allowed to mix.
Now the blender is switched OFF.
The blender is now taken from the bench and the lid is removed.
The blended orange peel extract is then transferred to a conical flask.
An adapter is fitted onto the mouth of a side armed conical flask and is taken from the lab bench.
A Buchner funnel is taken from the lab bench and is fitted into the mouth of the conical flask through the adapter. A filter paper is taken from the box.
It is then placed into the bottom surface of Buchner funnel .
The cap of the bottle with celite powder is opened and the bottle is taken from the lab bench.
Using spatula , some amount of celite powder is taken from the bottle
Evenly spread onto the filter paper laid on the Buchner funnel.
A vacuum pump is connected to the side arm of the conical flask.
The blended orange peel extract is taken from the lab bench.
The orange peel extract is then transferred into the Buchner funnel.
The vacuum pump is then switched ON.
The orange peel extract is getting filtered through the funnel into the new conical flask.
The vacuum pump is switched off and the Buchner funnel is taken off from the conical flask.
The lid of the bottle labeled “Orange peel Extract” is removed and a funnel is fitted onto the mouth of the bottle.
The conical flask containing filtered orange peel extract is taken from the lab bench and the adapter is removed.
The filtered extract is then transferred to the bottle labeled “Orange peel Extract”.
The tube containing p-nitrophenol is taken from the rack.
Few drops of p- nitrophenyl acetate is taken from the tube using a dropper.
The tube is then kept back into the rack and another tube labeled “pNPA + buffer “is taken from the rack.
The p- nitrophenyl acetate from the dropper is added to the tube labeled “pNPA + buffer” and the lid of the tube is tightened.
The tube is then kept back on the rack.
Dropper take from the rack.
The lid of the standard flask containing 0.1M phosphate buffer is removed and 6 drops of the buffer is taken using a dropper.
The tube containing “pNPA + buffer “ is taken from the rack.
The buffer from the dropper is added to the tube containing “pNPA + buffer.
The tube is then shaken well.
Another tube labeled “p- nitrophenyl acetate” is taken from the rack.
Using a dropper, few drops of p- nitrophenyl acetate is taken from the tube.
The tube is then kept back in the rack and another tube labeled “ pNPA + orange peel extract” is taken from the rack.
The p- nitrophenyl acetate in the dropper is transferred to the tube labeled “ pNPA + orange peel extract”.
The tube is then kept back in the rack.
Few drops of orange peel extract is taken from the bottle using a dropper.
The tube labeled “pNPA + orange peel extract” is taken from the rack.
The orange peel extract is then transferred to the “pNPA + orange peel extract” tube.
The tube is then shaken well.
The tube is then replaced back into the rack.

The conical flask containing TLC solvent “ Petroleum ether : ethyl acetate” is taken from the lab bench and the aluminium foil is removed from the mouth of the flask. A 5ml of the solvent is transferred to the measuring cylinder. The conical flask is then kept back on the bench.
The lid of the TLC chamber is removed and the TLC solvent in the measuring cylinder is transferred to the chamber and the lid is replaced.
A TLC plate is taken from the box.
The plate is placed on the lab bench. A capillary tube is taken from the case.
The tube containing pNPA + buffer is taken from the lab bench.
The capillary tube is immersed into the tube and some amount of contents is drawn into the capillary tube.
The contents in the capillary tube is spotted onto the TLC plate and dried using a blow dryer.
Another capillary tube is taken from the case.
The tube labeled “pNPA + orange peel extract” is taken from the rack.
The capillary tube is immersed into the tube and some amount of contents is drawn into the capillary tube.
The contents in the capillary tube is spotted onto the TLC plate and dried using a blow dryer.
The tube labeled p- nitrophenyl acetate is taken from the rack.
The contents are drawn into a new capillary tube.
The contents in the capillary tube is spotted onto the TLC plate and dried using a blow dryer.
The tube is then kept in a beaker filled with cotton.
The tube labeled “pNPA + buffer” is taken from the rack .
The tube is then kept in a beaker filled with cotton.
The tube labeled “pNPA + orange peel extract” is taken from the rack .
The tube is then kept in a beaker filled with cotton.The beaker is taken from the lab bench.
The door of the shaker is opened and the beaker with the tubes is placed inside the shaker for 30 minutes incubation and the door is closed.
The TLC plate is taken from the bench.

The lid of the TLC chamber containing the TLC solvent is removed and the TLC plate is kept in the chamber such that bottom of the plate is immersed in the solvent. The solvent will start to rise through the plate and the plate is then taken out from the chamber as soon as the solvent rises till 1 cm below from the top of the TLC plate.
The solvent front is marked on the plate using a pencil.The plate is then dried using blow drier and is taken from the bench.
The plate is kept in spray chamber and potassium permanganate solution is sprayed from the spray bottle.
The spots developed are observed.
The beaker with tubes is taken out from the shaker .
The beaker is placed on the lab bench.
A TLC plate is taken from the box.
The plate is placed on the lab bench.A capillary tube is taken from the case.
The tube labeled “pNPA + buffer” is taken from the rack.
The capillary tube is immersed into the tube and some amount of contents is drawn into the capillary tube.
The contents in the capillary tube is spotted onto the TLC plate and dried using a blow dryer.
Another capillary tube is taken from the case.
The tube labeled ““ pNPA + orange peel extract” is taken from the rack.
The capillary tube is immersed into the tube and some amount of contents is drawn into the capillary tube.
The contents in the capillary tube is spotted onto the TLC plate and dried using a blow dryer.
The tube labeled p-nitrophenol is taken from the rack.
The contents are drawn into a new capillary tube.
The contents in the capillary tube is spotted onto the TLC plate and dried using a blow dryer.
The tube is then kept in a beaker filled with cotton.
The tube labeled “pNPA + buffer” is taken from the rack.
The tube is then kept in a beaker filled with cotton.
The tube labeled “pNPA + orange peel extract” is taken from the rack.
The tube is then kept in a beaker filled with cotton.The beaker is taken from the lab bench.
The door of the shaker is opened and the beaker with the tubes is placed inside the shaker and the door is closed.
The TLC plate is taken from the bench.

The lid of the TLC chamber containing the TLC solvent is removed and the TLC plate is kept in the chamber such that bottom of the plate is immersed in the solvent. The solvent will start to rise through the plate and the plate is then taken out from the chamber as soon as the solvent rises till 1 cm below from the top of the TLC plate.
The solvent front is marked on the plate using a pencil.The plate is then dried using blow drier and is taken from the bench.
He plate is kept in spray chamber and potassium permanganate solution is sprayed from the spray bottle.
The plate is kept in spray chamber and potassium permanganate solution is sprayed from the spray bottle.
